com.intel.util

Class SharedPreferencesUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.SharedPreferencesUtil

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class SharedPreferencesUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to help read and write SharedPreferences. Although this class is thread-safe, it is NOT multi-process safe.

    Guidelines for the naming convention of preference keys are are that the field name contains the type of the key's value and finally the human readable identifier of the key's value. The field's assigned value MUST be 40 characters. The SHA-1 of the Java field-name could be one example to generate this 40 characters. This is to make the key-names of SharedPreferences more obscure to crackers. The string constant for a given field should remain constant between releases, in order to ensure that no data is lost.

      • getLong

        @Slow(value=MILLISECONDS)
public static long getLong(@NonNull
                                                     android.content.Context context,
                                                     @NonNull
                                                     java.lang.String key,
                                                     long defaultValue)
        Gets a long for a given SharedPreferences key.
        Parameters:
        context - ApplicationContext to do preference lookup.
        key - to perform preference lookup.
        defaultValue - the default long value.
        Returns:
        long representing the stored preference value. If the preference didn't exist, it returns default value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if key is not 40-characters in length.
